column4: Problem with Chromium in ubuntu 11.10. Won't start terminal says. Segmentation fault refers to apps/chromium.rc not existing
what is the output of:  lsb_release -sc
you could try:    mv ~/.config/chromium ~/.config/chromium_old       then rerun the browser
it's running starts do you want output?
run the browser now and you will have a default profile, does it run ok?
no it starts but when I try to sign in it quits would you like the output?
now it is back to not opening at all
strange, you can rename the old profile back if you want the old profile back :), I'd report a bug
never done that don't know how
entered ubuntu-bug chromium-browser  output was segmentation fault. Is that what I wanted?
Tried running ubuntu-bug chromium-browser it just said segmentation fault
Okay I am sweating now... Fresh install time?
I thought that the failure to be able to report the bug might mean that there is a bigger problem
there is a web interface you can use
